attributes.action: Reform family law incorporating both private and public cases
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
For fit grandparents to play a major role in the lives of grandchildren following family breakdown (Separation, divorce etc). Currently grandparents are systematically discouraged from being involved in contact issues.

Article 8 human rights(the right to a private and family life)regarding Baby P if social services had accepted grandparents concerns it may have saved his life.The government must recognise grandparents as an important valuable resource.

Grandparents are forced to be spectators in family breakdown when parents subsequently separate.The system should encourage all family members to be actively involved with the children. 

The general public does not have confidence in the machinations of public servants ( Social Services , CAFCASS and other so called experts) – The government is urged to have open justice to provide transparency in the system of family law. This petition demands that grandparents are considered as a primary resource for the emotional well being of the 
grandchildren when the parental relationship has broken down.
